meanings.definition: The quality of being abortive or unsuccessful.
meanings.sent2: The abortiveness of the plan led to its failure.
meanings.sent3: The abortiveness of the cake made it look like a pancake.
meanings.sent4: The abortiveness of the relationship left him feeling lost.
meanings.sent5: The abortiveness of the rocket launch was evident in its sudden stop.

meanings.definition: The state of being incomplete or imperfect.
meanings.sent1: The abortiveness of the puzzle frustrated her.
meanings.sent2: His painting showed signs of abortiveness in the corner.
meanings.sent3: The abortiveness of the story left the readers hanging.
meanings.sent4: The abortiveness of the bridge made it unsafe to cross.
meanings.sent5: The abortiveness of the plan was evident in its missing details.

meanings.sent1: The abortiveness of the meeting surprised everyone.
meanings.sent2: His speech was cut short by the abortiveness of the microphone.
meanings.sent3: The abortiveness of the game made it more challenging.
meanings.sent4: The abortiveness of the movie left the audience wanting more.
meanings.sent5: The abortiveness of the storm caught us off guard.
